[{"id":"JT-49099","entityId":"25-2112400","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"49099"},{"name":"summary","value":"New Issue inputs placeholders have wrong vertical alignment comparing with text"},{"name":"description","value":"

Normally placeholder should take exactly same place as text does

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1536574569674"},{"name":"updated","value":"1536574719568"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"Andrey.Skladchikov"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Andrey Skladchikov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Andrey.Skladchikov"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Andrey Skladchikov"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-921","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Issue Creation"],"valueId":["Issue Creation"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Cosmetics"],"valueId":["Cosmetics"],"color":{"bg":"#b7e281","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 75","id":"YouTrack:sprint 75"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"Sep-10-2018 13-14-06.gif","id":"74-565330","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/Sep-10-2018%2013-14-06.gif?file=74-565330&c=true"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-49082","entityId":"25-2111496","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"49082"},{"name":"summary","value":"Revise Recalculate Time Tracking dialog"},{"name":"description","value":"

Update wording:

Recalculate Time Tracking

Time tracking values are currently calculated based on a working period of [x] per day. This includes spent time in work items, calculated values in the field that stores total spent time, estimations, and all fields that store values as a period type. You have two options when you change this setting:

  • Preserve minutes ([x]m = [x]d becomes [y]m = [y]d[y]m)m = [x]d becomes [y]m = [y]d[y]m)
  • Preserve days ([x]m = [x]d becomes [y]m = [y]m)m = [x]d becomes [y]m = [y]m)

[Confirm] [Cancel]

  • The values in the sample calulation for each option is calculated based on the number of minutes that equals one day for the previous and current value in the **Working period per day setting. For example, the setting is changed from 8h to 7h30m:
    • Preserve minutes (480m = 1d becomes 480m = 1d30m)
    • Preserve days (480m = 1d becomes 450m = 1d)
  • Options are shown as radio buttons, default is Preserve minutes.
  • Confirm applies the selection. Calculations are updated accordingly.
  • Cancel closes the dialog and reverts the change to the setting.

Please note the changes to the wording of the dialog body. I moved the position of the placeholder so it can't form a sentence that is gramattically incorrect.

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1536329682139"},{"name":"updated","value":"1536569513395"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"Alexey.Volkov"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexey Volkov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Scott.Adams"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Scott Adams"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-928","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"Alexey.Volkov","fullName":"Alexey Volkov"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Time Tracking"],"valueId":["Time Tracking"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 75","id":"YouTrack:sprint 75"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-3058472","author":"Scott.Adams","authorFullName":"Scott Adams","issueId":"JT-49082","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Alexey Volkov - what do you think?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536329694305,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-48790","entityId":"25-2095640","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"48790"},{"name":"summary","value":"Can't add an Issue Distribution Report widget to a dashboard"},{"name":"description","value":"

STR:

  • go to a dashboard on hub.jetbrains.com
  • add the widget
  • select YouTrack
  • select New Report
  • enter a name for the report (I used "TestReport")
  • select Hub as a project
  • click Save

AR:

  • An error "Cannot save report: Property FlatDistributionReport.name is invalid" is shown
  • The json of the POST request doesn't include required data
{"$type":"jetbrains.youtrack.reports.impl.distribution.flat.gap.FlatDistributionReport","name":"","projects":[],"xsortOrder":"COUNT_INDEX_DESC","xaxis":{"field":{"$type":"jetbrains.charisma.keyword.PredefinedFilterField","id":"project","presentation":"project"}},"query":"","own":true}

ER: widget configuration ends successfully

STR:

  1. refresh the page
  2. press some tabs with Alt+Ctrl mouse click fast enough
  3. one tab will show changes from another (probably empty)

http://www.screencast.com/t/8lFOTI2d

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536222504042,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"jetbrains-team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3056524","author":"rekolobov","authorFullName":"Roman Kolobov","issueId":"JT-49050","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Or the same happens when the backend responds slowly:

  • open any FSI with only comments on
  • suspend the app (Ctrl+Z, debugger, etc)
  • ctrl+alt+click on history, then ctrl+alt+click on comments
  • resume the app

AR: history is shown
ER: comments are shown

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1536235778535,"updated":1536235839750,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-3056529","author":"pavel.nikitin","authorFullName":"Pavel Nikitin","issueId":"JT-49050","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Roman Kolobov I guess it's either you have to be fast or the backend has to be slow :) If you manage to be faster, you got this reproduced :)
